channel.title: Un garçon pas comme les autres (Bayes)
channel.description: A footnote that got out of control.

item.title: Sparse matrices part 6: To catch a derivative, first you've got to think like a derivative
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: Open up the kennels, Kenneth. Mamma’s coming home tonight.

item.title: Sparse Matrices 5: I bind you Nancy
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: A new JAX primitive? In this economy?

item.title: Design is my passion: sparse matrices part four
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: Just some harmeless notes. Like the ones Judy Dench took in that movie.

item.title: Sparse matrices part 3: Failing at JAX
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: _Takes a long drag on cigarette._ JAX? Where was he when I had my cancer?

item.title: An invitation to a sparse Cholesky factorisation
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: Come for the details, stay for the shitty Python, leave with disappointment. Not unlike the experience of dating me.

item.title: The linear algebra of linear mixed effects models and their generalisations
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: Hubris. Just hubris. But before the fall comes the statement of purpose. This is that statement.

item.title: Barry Gibb came fourth in a Barry Gibb look alike contest (Repost)
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: A repost from Andrew's blog about comparing computational methods for performing a task. (Lightly edited.) Original posted 20 October, 2017.

item.title: Why won't you cheat with me? (Repost)
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: A repost from Andrew's blog about how design information infects multivariate priors. (Lightly edited. Well, a bit more than lightly because the last version didn't fully make sense. But whatever. Blogs, eh.) Original posted 5 November, 2017.

item.title: The king must die (repost)
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: A repost (with edits, revisions, and footnotes) from Andrew's blog about how much I hate the Bayesian Lasso. Originally published 2nd November, 2017.

item.title: Getting into the subspace; or what happens when you approximate a Gaussian process
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: Fuck man, I don't know about this one. A lot of stuff happens. At some point there's a lot of PDEs. There are proofs. Back away.

item.title: Yes but what is a Gaussian process? or, Once, twice, three times a definition; or A descent into madness
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: Gaussian processes. As narrated by an increasingly deranged man during a day of torrential rain.

item.title: Priors: Fire With Fire (Track 3)
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: Objective priors? In finite dimensions? A confidence trick? Yes.

item.title: Priors: Whole New Way (Track 2)
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: Conjugate Priors? The crystal deoderant of Bayesian statistics

item.title: Priors: Night work (Track 1)
item.dc:creator: Dan Simpson
item.description: Priors? Defined. Questions? Outlined. Purpose? Declared.
